message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD 

This paper combines neural image captioning with a Rational Speech Acts (RSA) model to produce captions that are not only true but also distinguish their inputs from similar images. This involves natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV) techniques, which are commonly associated with the arXiv sub-categories cs.CL and cs.CV. Additionally, the paper introduces an automatic method for testing the performance of pragmatic speaker models, which could fall under the sub-categories cs.AI (artificial intelligence) or cs.LG (machine learning). Finally, the paper also discusses efficiency in the implementation of RSA, which could relate to the sub-category cs.SD (systems and control).
